item.title: Leaked draft opinion suggests U.S. high court will overturn Roe v. Wade: Politico report
item.description: A draft opinion suggests the U.S. Supreme Court could be poised to overturn the landmark 1973 Roe v. Wade case that legalized abortion nationwide, according to a Politico report released Monday.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.enclosure: The U.S. Supreme Court is seen before sunrise on Capitol Hill in Washington, Monday, March. 21, 2022. (AP Photo/Jose Luis Magana)

item.title: Australian man gets 12 years for murdering gay American more than 30 years ago
item.description: An Australian man was sentenced to 12 years and seven months in prison Tuesday for the 1988 murder of an American who fell off a Sydney cliff that was known as a gay meeting place.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.enclosure: Steve Johnson, right, with his sisters, Terry, left, and Rebecca and his wife Rosemarie, second right, arrive at the Supreme Court in Sydney, May 2, 2022, for a sentencing hearing in the murder of Scott Johnson, Steve, Terry and Rebecca's brother. (AP Photo/Rick Rycroft)

item.title: Civilians rescued from Mariupol steel plant head for safety
item.description: Russia resumed pulverizing the Mariupol steel mill that has become the last stronghold of resistance in the bombed-out city, Ukrainian fighters said Monday, after a brief cease-fire over the weekend allowed the first evacuation of civilians from the plant.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.enclosure: Andrii Fedorov hugs his son Makar as they reunited at a reception center for displaced people in Zaporizhzhia, Ukraine, Monday, May 2, 2022. (AP Photo/Francisco Seco)

item.title: Muslims mark Eid al-Fitr holiday with joy, worry
item.description: This year, Muslims around the world are observing Eid al-Fitr -- typically marked with communal prayers, celebratory gatherings around festive meals and new clothes -- in the shadow of a surge in global food prices exacerbated by the war in Ukraine.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.enclosure: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau attends Eid prayers in Ottawa on May 2, 2022. (Sean Kilpatrick / THE CANADIAN PRESS)

item.title: Some Afghan refugees settling into life in Canada, but others still stranded
item.description: An organization that raised money to get interpreters out of the Taliban’s reach is winding down its fundraising campaign today, but is still pushing Ottawa to save the lives of those it promised to help, many of whom are still stranded in Afghanistan.
item.dc:creator: Genevieve Beauchemin
item.creditLine: CTV National News Quebec Bureau Chief
item.enclosure: A Taliban fighter stands guard around the site of an explosion in a mosque, in Kabul, Afghanistan, Friday, April 29, 2022. (AP Photo/Ebrahim Noroozi)

item.title: Trump appeal: US$10K fine in record search 'unconscionable'
item.description: In a court appeal, a lawyer for Donald Trump said Monday it is 'unconscionable and indefensible' for the ex-U.S. president to be held in contempt and fined US$10,000 a day for failing to turn over documents he doesn't possess.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.enclosure: Former U.S. President Donald Trump speaks from the podium during a rally, Sunday, May 1, 2022, in Greenwood, Neb. (Kenneth Ferriera/Lincoln Journal Star via AP, File)

item.title: Boston violated free speech rights by refusing to fly Christian flag: U.S. Supreme Court
item.description: A unanimous U.S. Supreme Court ruled Monday that Boston violated the free speech rights of a conservative activist when it refused his request to fly a Christian flag on a flagpole outside City Hall.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.enclosure: The American flag, the Commonwealth of Massachusetts flag, and the City of Boston flag, from left, fly outside Boston City Hall, Monday, May 2, 2022, in Boston. (AP Photo/Charles Krupa)

item.title: Arrest warrant issued in Alabama for missing jail official
item.description: Authorities issued an arrest warrant Monday for a jail official who they say helped an inmate awaiting trial on a murder charge to escape from an Alabama jail. A search was on for the pair.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.enclosure: Assistant Director of Corrections Vicki White. (Lauderdale County Sheriff's Office via AP)

item.title: Trump faces biggest test of his 'king-maker' clout since leaving White House
item.description: The month of May brings Donald Trump the biggest test of his political clout since the end of his presidency, as candidates he has endorsed contest Republican primaries that will set the stage for November's midterm congressional elections.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
item.enclosure: U.S. Rep. Max Miller, left, of Ohio, greets former President Donald Trump at a rally at the Delaware County Fairgrounds, Saturday, April 23, 2022, in Delaware, Ohio, to endorse Republican candidates ahead of the Ohio primary on May 3. (AP Photo/Joe Maiorana)

item.title: Push to arm Ukraine putting strain on U.S. weapons stockpile
item.description: As the U.S. continue to advocate for aiding Ukraine's fight against Russia there is growing concern as the war drags on: Can the U.S. sustain the cadence of shipping vast amounts of arms to Ukraine while maintaining the healthy stockpile it may need if a new conflict erupts with North Korea, Iran or elsewhere?
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.enclosure: Fuses for 155 mm shells ultimately bound for Ukraine are prepared to be loaded on a C-17 flight, Friday, April 29, 2022, at Dover Air Force Base, Del. (AP Photo/Alex Brandon)
